S. Korean Ultra-Right Conservatives' Crimes under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Ultra-Right Conservatives' Crimes under Fire 
    Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- At least 60 elders of civic and public organizations of south Korea including the "National Alliance for Democracy and Reunification" reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on Dec. 9.
 At the press conference they accused gentry of the wicked conservative organizations of destroying the gravestones of unconverted long-term prisoners in Yonhwa Park in Pogwang Temple, Kwangthan-myon, Phaju City, Kyonggi Province and desecrating their remains on Dec. 5. We cannot repress our resentment at such extreme acts and violent attitude of the conservative forces including the Grand National Party of south Korea as depriving them of even the space to lie in state after their death, they declared.    
 Such treacherous vandalism can never be pardoned under any circumstances, they said, strongly demanding the authorities repatriate unconverted long-term prisoners remaining in south Korea to the north as early as possible and promptly send back the remains of those dead ones to it. 
 Four orders including Christianity, Buddhism and Round Buddhism organized a measure committee with religious organizations on Dec. 12 and declared that it would wage a campaign protesting against the vandalism of the conservative forces.

Anti-DPRK Outcries of U.S. Ambassador in Seoul Flailed
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Outcries of U.S. Ambassador in Seoul Flailed
    Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- The U.S. outcries terming the DPRK a "criminal state" along with its reckless remarks designating it as "part of an axis of evil" and an "outpost of tyranny." are premeditated provocative remarks intended to violate the Korean nation's right to existence and hamstring its efforts for independent reunification.
 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary blasting the U.S. ambassador in Seoul for making such outcries. 
 What should not be overlooked is that those outcries are made at a time when the U.S. administration has escalated its pressure upon the DPRK by applying financial sanctions against it in contravention of the joint statement at the fourth round of the six-party talks, the commentary says, and goes on:
 The developments prove that the U.S. is deliberately bedeviling its relations with the DPRK in a bid to fundamentally overturn the spirit of the joint declaration and break up the talks.    
 The U.S. once said it recognizes the DPRK as "a sovereign state" and "respects" it. Clearer is that the recent outpourings were nothing but tongue-rolling to deceive the public opinion. The reality goes to prove that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK aimed to overturn its system remains unchanged. The U.S. should be held fully responsible for all the consequences to be entailed by its reckless remarks seriously getting on the nerves of the DPRK by calling it a "criminal state" and straining the bilateral relations.

articles.content:
Executive Director of WFP and His Party Arrive Here
    Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- James T. Morris, executive director of the World Food Programme (WFP), and his party arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Richard Ragan, country director of the WFP Office in the DPRK.

articles.title: Meeting Held to Mark 20th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Mark 20th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work
    Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place here today to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Stepping Up the Work of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea".
 Chairman Kang Chang Uk of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, in his report at the meeting said that 
Kim Jong Il in the work gave a comprehensive exposition of the nature and duty of the union, supreme principles of building it and its activities, tasks of the union and ways of carrying them out and other theoretical and practical problems arising in building of the union and its activities.
 In the work Kim Jong Il formulated the union as a mass political organisation of socialist agricultural workers and underscored the need to rally the farmers closer around the Workers' Party of Korea and encourage them to a drive to build a socialist countryside and increase agricultural production, he said, and went on:    
 Ever since the publication of the work he energetically led the work to enhance the militant functions and role of the union to meet the requirements of the developing revolution, thus developing the organisation into a Songun revolutionary organisation unfailingly loyal to the monolithic guidance of the Party.
 New changes have been effected in the 20-year-long work of the union and the organisation has grown to be a genuine Songun revolutionary organisation which is taking the lead in the devoted defence of the leader. The credit for this goes to his seasoned guidance and his Juche-based idea and theory of building the union.    
 The reporter called upon all organisations and officials of the union to implement to the letter the militant tasks laid down in the work in hearty response to Kim Jong Il's idea and guidance so as to make a tangible contribution to the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation.
 He underlined the need to build up union committees at all levels as well as primary organisations, the base of political life of union members, in order to further enhance the militant functions and role of the union organisations.

articles.title: North Side's Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
North Side's Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- A north side's delegation led by Chief Councillor Kwon Ho Ung of the Cabinet left here today to attend the 17th North-South Ministerial Talks to be held on Jeju Island of south Korea.
 It was seen off at the airport by Minister of Education Kim Yong Jin, Chairman of the National Economic Cooperation Committee Jong Un Op and others.
